name: Breath of Fire
description: Rapid, rhythmic breathing with focus on forceful exhales and passive inhales.
explanation: This pranayama technique increases oxygen levels, energizes the nervous system, and helps clear mental fog through rapid diaphragmatic breathing.
when_to_use: Morning energy boost, mental clarity, warming the body, or before physical activity.

round_messages.text: Focus on sharp, forceful exhales. Let the inhales happen naturally.
If you feel dizzy, slow down or take a break.
Take slow, deep breaths to integrate the energy.
Double the repetitions. Maintain the rhythm but don't strain.
This is intense - listen to your body.
Well done! Allow the energy to settle through deep breathing.

pre_session.text: This is an intense technique - ensure you're in good health.
Sit with spine straight, hands on knees.
Focus will be on sharp exhales using your diaphragm.
Never practice if pregnant, with heart conditions, or high blood pressure.

on_start.text: Begin with rapid, rhythmic breathing. Exhale sharp, inhale passive.

on_end.text: Excellent work! You should feel energized and mentally clear.
Sit quietly for a few minutes to fully integrate the practice.
This technique becomes easier and more beneficial with regular practice.

cautions: NOT suitable for pregnant women or those with cardiovascular conditions.
Avoid if you have high or low blood pressure, epilepsy, or respiratory issues.
Stop immediately if you feel dizzy, nauseous, or unwell.
Start with shorter sessions and build up gradually.
Practice on empty stomach - wait 2-3 hours after eating.
This technique can be very stimulating - avoid before bedtime.
